meanings.definition: The act of impelling or driving forward.
meanings.sent1: The impulsion of the wind pushed the sailboat forward.
meanings.sent2: The impulsion of the car's engine made it speed up.
meanings.sent3: The impulsion of the toddler to explore led to a messy room.
meanings.sent4: The impulsion of curiosity drove her to uncover the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The impulsion of the river flowing downstream was unstoppable.

meanings.definition: A force that causes something to move or act.
meanings.sent1: The impulsion of the magnet attracted the metal objects.
meanings.sent2: The impulsion of fear made him run faster.
meanings.sent3: The impulsion of hunger drove her to raid the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The impulsion of love guided his actions towards kindness.
meanings.sent5: The impulsion of gravity pulls objects towards the Earth.
